content.description: The middle line on the wall. Steep pulls just left of the black waterstreak lead to a small shelf. The upper slab is easier but pleasant.
content.location: Center of the wall up a waterstreak.

content.description: A short, right-leaning route which ends on a ledge. Devious technical maneuvering.
content.location: The right-hand route on the wall.

content.description: This route heads left after the 5th bolt of Labor of Love.  Fun sustained climbing, with a couple spots being a little harder.
content.protection: A total of 18 bolts to the double bolt anchor. Some longer runners will be useful.
content.location:
This route follows the left-most edge of the wall to the top.

It is not advisable to rappel from the top anchors on this route.  You'll need two ropes, and the falling rope will get all messed up in the chimney.  Instead, scramble to the top and use the anchors at the top of Finishing the Job.   They are poorly equipped for rappelling and need to be improved. Only one has a ring. In the mean time, bring a piece of runner and a leaver biner, and be prepared to leave them behind.

content.description: A great route that is easier than Tough Loving, but offers more sustained steep climbing on the headwall. Some sinker jugs pepper the route in pleasant contrast to the typical shallow Steamboat solution pockets.
content.location: The leftmost line on the wall. Immediately right of the chimney which separates this wall from the Moderate Wall.

content.description: This route (D on the topo) is simply a continuation of earlier routes that ended at a ledge system about 90' up.  Move left from the belay/rappel anchor and head for the top.
content.protection: If you are doing the route in two pitches, 9 draws for bolts.  If you are going for full value and are doing it in one pitch, 17 draws.  Although there are anchors at the very top, they are poorly equipped for rappelling and need to be improved.  Only one has a ring.  In the mean time, bring a piece of runner and a leaver biner, and be prepared to leave them behind.  Otherwise, walk off.
content.location: This west facing wall is on the south side of the cliff, and is very near the trail.  Leave the main trail below the wall and take the path to the base
